commit.message:
configure.in (djgpp): Revert previous patch.

        * configure.in (djgpp): Revert previous patch.
        * configure: Rebuit.
        * config/i386/djgpp.h: Revert previous patch.

From-SVN: r30006

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,9 @@
+Fri Oct 15 00:05:00 1999  Jeffrey A Law  (law@cygnus.com)
+
+	* configure.in (djgpp): Revert previous patch.
+	* configure: Rebuit.
+	* config/i386/djgpp.h: Revert previous patch.
+
 Fri Oct 15 00:00:24 1999  Loren J. Rittle <ljrittle@acm.org>
 
 	* fixinc/inclhack.def: Restore patch lost during last merge of

@@ -33,14 +33,6 @@ Boston, MA 02111-1307, USA.  */
 
 #include "i386/gas.h"
 
-/* Define the name of the .text section.  */
-#undef TEXT_SECTION_ASM_OP
-#define TEXT_SECTION_ASM_OP "\t.section .text"
-
-/* Define the name of the .data section.  */
-#undef DATA_SECTION_ASM_OP
-#define DATA_SECTION_ASM_OP "\t.section .data"
-
 /* If defined, a C expression whose value is a string containing the
    assembler operation to identify the following data as
    uninitialized global data.  If not defined, and neither
@@ -49,31 +41,12 @@ Boston, MA 02111-1307, USA.  */
    `-fno-common' is passed, otherwise `ASM_OUTPUT_COMMON' will be
    used.  */
 #undef BSS_SECTION_ASM_OP
-#define BSS_SECTION_ASM_OP "\t.section .bss"
-
-/* Define the name of the .ctor section.  */
-#undef CTORS_SECTION_ASM_OP
-#define CTORS_SECTION_ASM_OP    "\t.section .ctor"
-
-/* Define the name of the .data section.  */
-#undef DTORS_SECTION_ASM_OP
-#define DTORS_SECTION_ASM_OP    "\t.section .dtor"
+#define BSS_SECTION_ASM_OP "\t.section\t.bss"
 
 /* Enable alias attribute support.  */
-#undef SET_ASM_OP
+#ifndef SET_ASM_OP
 #define SET_ASM_OP "\t.set"
-
-/* Define the name of the .init section.  */
-#undef INIT_SECTION_ASM_OP
-#define INIT_SECTION_ASM_OP "\t.section .init"
-
-/* Define the name of the .fini section.  */
-#undef FINI_SECTION_ASM_OP
-#define FINI_SECTION_ASM_OP "\t.section .fini"
-
-/* Define the name of the .eh_frame section.  */
-#undef EH_FRAME_SECTION_ASM_OP
-#define EH_FRAME_SECTION_ASM_OP "\t.section .eh_frame"
+#endif
 
 /* Search for as.exe and ld.exe in DJGPP's binary directory. */ 
 #define MD_EXEC_PREFIX "$DJDIR/bin/"
@@ -89,7 +62,7 @@ Boston, MA 02111-1307, USA.  */
 #define CPP_PREDEFINES "-Dunix -Di386 -DGO32 -DDJGPP=2 -DMSDOS \
   -Asystem(unix) -Asystem(msdos) -Acpu(i386) -Amachine(i386)"
 
-/* We need to override link_command_spec in gcc.c to call stubify.exe.
+/* We need to override link_command_spec in gcc.c so support -Tdjgpp.djl.
    This cannot be done in LINK_SPECS as that LINK_SPECS is processed
    before library search directories are known by the linker.
    This avoids problems when specs file is not available. An alternate way,
@@ -105,7 +78,7 @@ Boston, MA 02111-1307, USA.  */
 \t%{static:} %{L*} %D %o\
 \t%{!nostdlib:%{!nodefaultlibs:%G %L %G}}\
 \t%{!A:%{!nostdlib:%{!nostartfiles:%E}}}\
-\t%{T*}}}}}}}\n\
+\t-Tdjgpp.djl %{T*}}}}}}}\n\
 %{!c:%{!M:%{!MM:%{!E:%{!S:stubify %{v} %{o*:%*} %{!o*:a.out} }}}}}"
 
 /* Always just link in 'libc.a'.  */
@@ -114,14 +87,7 @@ Boston, MA 02111-1307, USA.  */
 
 /* Pick the right startup code depending on the -pg flag.  */
 #undef STARTFILE_SPEC
-#define STARTFILE_SPEC "%{pg:gcrt0.o%s}%{!pg:crt0.o%s} crtbegin.o%s"
-
-/* Link in crtbegin.o and crtend.o for calling functions with the
-   constructor and destructor attribute.  Put the call to the
-   linker script here, and in front of crtend.o, or else the
-   resulting .exe won't have any symbols.  */
-#undef ENDFILE_SPEC
-#define ENDFILE_SPEC "-Tdjgpp.djl crtend.o%s"
+#define STARTFILE_SPEC "%{pg:gcrt0.o%s}%{!pg:crt0.o%s}"
 
 /* Make sure that gcc will not look for .h files in /usr/local/include 
    unless user explicitly requests it.  */
@@ -135,7 +101,6 @@ Boston, MA 02111-1307, USA.  */
   CTOR_SECTION_FUNCTION						\
   DTOR_SECTION_FUNCTION
 
-#undef CTOR_SECTION_FUCTION
 #define CTOR_SECTION_FUNCTION					\
 void								\
 ctor_section ()							\
@@ -147,7 +112,6 @@ ctor_section ()							\
     }								\
 }
 
-#undef DTOR_SECTION_FUNCTION
 #define DTOR_SECTION_FUNCTION					\
 void								\
 dtor_section ()							\
@@ -159,7 +123,6 @@ dtor_section ()							\
     }								\
 }
 
-#undef ASM_OUTPUT_CONSTRUCTOR
 #define ASM_OUTPUT_CONSTRUCTOR(FILE,NAME)	\
   do {						\
     ctor_section ();				\
@@ -169,13 +132,11 @@ dtor_section ()							\
   } while (0)
 
 /* Allow (eg) __attribute__((section "locked")) to work */
-#undef ASM_OUTPUT_SECTION_NAME
 #define ASM_OUTPUT_SECTION_NAME(FILE, DECL, NAME, RELOC)\
   do {						\
     fprintf (FILE, "\t.section %s\n", NAME);	\
   } while (0)
 
-#undef ASM_OUTPUT_DESTRUCTOR
 #define ASM_OUTPUT_DESTRUCTOR(FILE,NAME)	\
   do {						\
     dtor_section ();                   		\
@@ -206,15 +167,6 @@ dtor_section ()							\
 #define ASM_OUTPUT_ALIGNED_BSS(FILE, DECL, NAME, SIZE, ALIGN) \
   asm_output_aligned_bss ((FILE), (DECL), (NAME), (SIZE), (ALIGN))
 
-/* Define how DJGPP calls function pointers in the .ctor section.  */
-#undef DO_GLOBAL_CTORS_BODY
-#define DO_GLOBAL_CTORS_BODY						\
-  do {									\
-    func_ptr *p;								\
-    for (p = __CTOR_LIST__ + 1; *p ; p++)				\
-      (*p) ();								\
-  } while (0)
-
-/* Use the .fini section for destructors.  */
-#define CRTSTUFF_USE_FINI_SECTION
-
+/* djgpp automatically calls its own version of __main, so don't define one
+   in libgcc, nor call one in main().  */
+#define HAS_INIT_SECTION

@@ -4158,7 +4158,6 @@ for machine in $build $host $target; do
 		gnu_ld=yes
 		gas=yes
 		exeext=.exe
-		extra_parts="crtbegin.o crtend.o"
 		case $host in *pc-msdosdjgpp*)
 			target_alias=djgpp
 			;;
@@ -6642,15 +6641,15 @@ fi
 
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6646: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:6645: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6654 "configure"
+#line 6653 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -6661,7 +6660,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6665: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6664: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -6684,12 +6683,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6688: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:6687: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6693 "configure"
+#line 6692 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -6738,7 +6737,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6742: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6741: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -6759,21 +6758,21 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for inline""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6763: checking for inline" >&5
+echo "configure:6762: checking for inline" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_inline'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_cv_c_inline=no
 for ac_kw in inline __inline__ __inline; do
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6770 "configure"
+#line 6769 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
 } $ac_kw foo() {
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6777: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6776: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_inline=$ac_kw; break
 else
@@ -6799,12 +6798,12 @@ EOF
 esac
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6803: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6802: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6808 "configure"
+#line 6807 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6832,12 +6831,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6836: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:6835: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6841 "configure"
+#line 6840 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -6867,19 +6866,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6871: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:6870: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6876 "configure"
+#line 6875 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <alloca.h>
 int main() {
 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6883: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6882: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else
@@ -6900,12 +6899,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6904: checking for alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:6903: checking for alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_alloca_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6909 "configure"
+#line 6908 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #ifdef __GNUC__
@@ -6933,7 +6932,7 @@ int main() {
 char *p = (char *) alloca(1);
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6937: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6936: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_func_alloca_works=yes
 else
@@ -6965,12 +6964,12 @@ EOF
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6969: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
+echo "configure:6968: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_os_cray'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6974 "configure"
+#line 6973 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #if defined(CRAY) && ! defined(CRAY2)
 webecray
@@ -6995,12 +6994,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6
 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6999: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:6998: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7004 "configure"
+#line 7003 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7023,7 +7022,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7027: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7026: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7050,15 +7049,15 @@ done
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking stack direction for C alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7054: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:7053: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_stack_direction'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=0
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7062 "configure"
+#line 7061 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 find_stack_direction ()
 {
@@ -7077,7 +7076,7 @@ main ()
   exit (find_stack_direction() < 0);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7081: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:7080: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=1
 else
@@ -7104,17 +7103,17 @@ unistd.h sys/param.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7108: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:7107: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7113 "configure"
+#line 7112 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:7118: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:7117: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -7144,12 +7143,12 @@ done
 strdup __argz_count __argz_stringify __argz_next
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7148: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7147: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7153 "configure"
+#line 7152 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7172,7 +7171,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7176: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7175: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7201,12 +7200,12 @@ done
      for ac_func in stpcpy
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7205: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7204: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7210 "configure"
+#line 7209 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -7229,7 +7228,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7233: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7232: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7263,19 +7262,19 @@ EOF
 
    if test $ac_cv_header_locale_h = yes; then
     echo $ac_n "checking for LC_MESSAGES""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7267: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
+echo "configure:7266: checking for LC_MESSAGES" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7272 "configure"
+#line 7271 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <locale.h>
 int main() {
 return LC_MESSAGES
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7279: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7278: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   am_cv_val_LC_MESSAGES=yes
 else
@@ -7296,7 +7295,7 @@ EOF
     fi
   fi
    echo $ac_n "checking whether NLS is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7300: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:7299: checking whether NLS is requested" >&5
         # Check whether --enable-nls or --disable-nls was given.
 if test "${enable_nls+set}" = set; then
   enableval="$enable_nls"
@@ -7316,7 +7315,7 @@ fi
 EOF
 
       echo $ac_n "checking whether included gettext is requested""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7320: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
+echo "configure:7319: checking whether included gettext is requested" >&5
       # Check whether --with-included-gettext or --without-included-gettext was given.
 if test "${with_included_gettext+set}" = set; then
   withval="$with_included_gettext"
@@ -7335,17 +7334,17 @@ fi
 
 	ac_safe=`echo "libintl.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for libintl.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7339: checking for libintl.h" >&5
+echo "configure:7338: checking for libintl.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7344 "configure"
+#line 7343 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:7349: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:7348: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -7362,19 +7361,19 @@ fi
 if eval "test \"`echo '$ac_cv_header_'$ac_safe`\" = yes"; then
   echo "$ac_t""yes" 1>&6
   echo $ac_n "checking for gettext in libc""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7366: checking for gettext in libc" >&5
+echo "configure:7365: checking for gettext in libc" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gt_cv_func_gettext_libc'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7371 "configure"
+#line 7370 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <libintl.h>
 int main() {
 return (int) gettext ("")
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7378: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7377: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
